articles.title: NBA star's partnership with a prediction market raises new questions for a troubled sports betting landscape
articles.summary: An NBA player has partnered with a prediction market platform, adding another layer of complexity to sports betting's already messy regulatory and ethical landscape. The move signals prediction markets are aggressively courting mainstream sports figures, but it also hands regulators and leagues fresh ammunition to crack down on an industry they're already eyeing suspiciously.

articles.title: Kalshi CEO defends Khamenei market design after backlash, says platform will reimburse all fees
articles.summary: Kalshi CEO is pushing back against criticism of how the platform structured its market on Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei, promising to refund all trading fees to users. The controversy highlights how prediction markets still struggle with the optics and ethics of betting on geopolitical events, especially when market design decisions anger both traders and the broader public.

articles.title: 2 of the Best Prediction Market Stocks to Buy Now
articles.summary: Some finance publication is pushing prediction market stocks as hot investment picks right now. If these companies are getting Wall Street attention, it probably means the sector is hitting mainstream momentum that could bring more liquidity and legitimacy to the markets we actually bet on.

articles.title: Prediction markets indicate oil pop Monday, 20% rise this month
articles.summary: Prediction markets are betting on oil prices surging Monday and climbing 20% through the month, signaling traders expect a major supply disruption or geopolitical shock. The crude oil spike represents one of the biggest monthly moves markets are pricing in this year, creating serious profit opportunities for anyone positioned ahead of the crowd.

articles.title: Bitcoin Needs a Huge Rally to Hit $150,000 by December -- Are Polymarket's 12% Odds Too Low, Too High, or Just About Right?
articles.summary: Polymarket bettors are giving Bitcoin just 12% odds of hitting $150,000 by December, despite the crypto's notorious volatility and recent institutional adoption momentum. This low probability suggests either the market is being overly conservative about Bitcoin's rally potential, or traders have learned hard lessons from previous hype cycles and are pricing in the massive 3x gain required more realistically.

articles.title: From Water Breaks to Handshakes: How Prediction Markets Monetize the Mundane
articles.summary: Prediction markets are expanding beyond elections and economics to bet on everyday occurrences like when athletes take water breaks or whether politicians will shake hands at events. This shift toward micro-events creates new revenue streams for platforms while giving bettors action on literally anything that happens, turning ordinary moments into tradeable assets.

articles.title: Are Prediction Markets Mirroring Crypto's Boom?
articles.summary: Prediction markets are experiencing explosive growth that mirrors cryptocurrency's meteoric rise, with trading volumes and user adoption surging across platforms like Polymarket and Kalshi. This boom signals prediction markets are finally breaking into mainstream finance, which means more liquidity, tighter spreads, and better odds for serious bettors willing to capitalize on the influx of inexperienced money.

articles.title: Betting on suffering: The moral crisis of prediction markets
articles.summary: Critics are attacking prediction markets for allowing people to profit from tragic events like wars, natural disasters, and political violence. The backlash could trigger regulatory crackdowns that limit which events platforms can list, shrinking the already narrow range of markets available to bettors.

articles.title: Opinion | Gambling Is an Intelligence Asset
articles.summary: Someone's arguing that gambling operations provide valuable intelligence data that governments and organizations should treat as strategic assets. If they're right, expect regulators to start viewing prediction markets less as vice and more as information infrastructure worth protecting and accessing.

articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired high-profile Supreme Court attorney Neal Katyal to represent them in legal battles over prediction market regulation. The move signals Kalshi expects serious courtroom fights ahead as they push to expand beyond election betting into more controversial markets that regulators want to block.

articles.title: Who will win Survivor 50? Predictions, odds after Survivor premiere
articles.summary: Survivor 50's premiere has sparked early predictions and betting odds on which contestant will claim the $1M prize. Reality TV betting markets are growing fast, and with Survivor's massive fanbase analyzing every tribal council move, early odds can shift dramatically based on viewer sentiment and insider speculation.

articles.title: Two Insider Cases We’ve Recently Closed
articles.summary: Two insider trading cases just wrapped up, likely involving people who traded on non-public information before major announcements or market moves. These outcomes set important precedents for how regulators will treat prediction market traders who might have access to privileged information about political events, earnings, or other market-moving news.
